pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw: maybe `SonarVisual::Fini` needs to be created?

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw: I'm not sure why this seg-fault occurs, but `SonarVisualPrivate` has callbacks both for transport and an update event, so these should be cleared in a Fini function.
content.html: I'm not sure why this seg-fault occurs, but SonarVisualPrivate has callbacks both for transport and an update event, so these should be cleared in a Fini function.

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw: I'm looking into this. It might be a good idea to check if all visual classes are being properly terminated now.
content.html: I'm looking into this. It might be a good idea to check if all visual classes are being properly terminated now.

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw:
Added constructor / destructor for all* visuals which didn't have any tests, only minor changes were needed to get them all to pass.

* Except for `VideoVisual`, which doesn't work at all
content.html:
Added constructor / destructor for all* visuals which didn't have any tests, only minor changes were needed to get them all to pass.

  • Except for VideoVisual, which doesn't work at all

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw: It turns out that dynamic lines created with `Visual::CreateDynamic` are cleared by the Visual class, so there's no need to delete it in `SonarVisual`'s destructor's. So I removed it: eb96d5d
content.html: It turns out that dynamic lines created with Visual::CreateDynamic are cleared by the Visual class, so there's no need to delete it in SonarVisual's destructor's. So I removed it: eb96d5d

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.html:
I think this fixes it:

diff -r d44c13b597ad gazebo/gui/model/JointMaker.cc
--- a/gazebo/gui/model/JointMaker.cc    Tue Sep 13 18:40:25 2016 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/gui/model/JointMaker.cc    Wed Sep 14 13:44:11 2016 -0700
@@ -267,21 +267,12 @@

   if (joint->visual)
   {
-    scene->RemoveVisual(joint->visual);
     joint->visual->Fini();
   }

   if (joint->jointVisual)
   {
-    auto parentAxisVis = joint->jointVisual->GetParentAxisVisual();
-    if (parentAxisVis)
-    {
-      parentAxisVis->GetParent()->DetachVisual(parentAxisVis->GetName());
-      scene->RemoveVisual(parentAxisVis);
-    }
-    joint->jointVisual->GetParent()->DetachVisual(
-        joint->jointVisual->GetName());
-    scene->RemoveVisual(joint->jointVisual);
+    joint->jointVisual->Fini();
   }

   if (joint->inspector)
@@ -1911,4 +1902,3 @@
 {
   this->dataPtr->userCmdManager = _manager;
 }
-

calling Fini on the top level visual should now take care of removing all the children

content.raw: Does Fini need to be called multiple times? Or is this just testing that it can be called multiple times?
content.html: Does Fini need to be called multiple times? Or is this just testing that it can be called multiple times?

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw: It's just testing it. One of the reasons for failure was that it was being called multiple times and pointers which were cleaned the first time were being accessed the second time.
content.html: It's just testing it. One of the reasons for failure was that it was being called multiple times and pointers which were cleaned the first time were being accessed the second time.

pullrequest.title: Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks
Fix cleanup of visual with plugins that have callbacks

content.raw: I noticed that you made a lot of changes from `NULL` to `nullptr`. I also switched the test expectations in `Visual_TEST` away from true/false assertions like `ASSERT_TRUE(x != nullptr)` to ==/!= assertions like `ASSERT_NE(x, nullptr)`. It's in 5bbc48a07b72 (branch `issue_2047_scpeters`) if you're interested.
content.html: I noticed that you made a lot of changes from NULL to nullptr. I also switched the test expectations in Visual_TEST away from true/false assertions like ASSERT_TRUE(x != nullptr) to ==/!= assertions like ASSERT_NE(x, nullptr). It's in 5bbc48a07b72 (branch issue_2047_scpeters) if you're interested.
